p: The NS1-induced endothelial permeability ( Fig. 5 a) was accompanied by an increase in the number and size of paracellular gaps, as monitored by immunofluorescence staining ( Fig. 5, b and c). In response to stimulation with hyaluronan or knockdown of CD44, morphological changes occurred leading to formation of paracellular gaps, and enlargement of NS1-induced gaps, which was reverted by Hermes1 antibodies or treatment with Streptomyces hyaluronidase ( Fig. 5 b, c).
